intro: Zapoteca portoricensis subsp. flavida, commonly known as the Puerto Rican zapoteca, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its yellowish flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the mountainous regions of Puerto Rico. It has small, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
